meanings.definition: Exhibiting different colors when viewed under different lighting conditions.
meanings.sent1: The metachromatic painting looked blue in the sunlight and green under the lamp.
meanings.sent2: The metachromatic fabric shimmered in the daylight and glowed in the evening.
meanings.sent3: The chameleon claimed to have metachromatic skin that changed hues with the weather.
meanings.sent4: Her mood was as metachromatic as a rainbow, shifting from joy to sadness in an instant.
meanings.sent5: The metachromatic flowers in the garden seemed to dance with changing colors as the day progressed.

meanings.definition: A dye or stain that changes color depending on the chemical composition of the material it is applied to.
meanings.sent1: The scientist used a metachromatic dye to reveal the different components of the cell.
meanings.sent2: The artist experimented with a metachromatic stain to create a unique pattern on the fabric.
meanings.sent3: The detective solved the case by identifying the culprit through the metachromatic residue left at the scene.
meanings.sent4: The metachromatic ink on the document revealed hidden messages when exposed to a special light.
meanings.sent5: The metachromatic marker changed colors on contact with different surfaces, surprising the children.
